metadata.subject: Invitation to be a featured guest of Poetry in America

relationships.description: Powell M. Cabot Professor of American Literature at Harvard
Director and Host of Poetry in America
Creating educational materials for K-12 classrooms in partnership with Harvard

analysis.purpose: To invite Ms. Knowles-Carter to participate as a featured guest on the Poetry in America series
analysis.significance: Shows Harvard's outreach to high-profile celebrities for educational programming and the academic interest in contemporary poetry addressing race and gender issues

notable_quotes: You are the ideal reader for this poem.
Everything we create would be educational and non-commercial.
I would be very honored to work with you.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present - this is a standard professional invitation

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity mentioned or suggested

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a standard academic invitation letter from Harvard faculty to a public figure for educational programming

analysis.summary: Harvard Professor Elisa New invites Ms. Knowles-Carter to participate as a featured guest on the Poetry in America series to discuss Evie Shockley's poem 'you can say that again, billie,' which addresses themes of race and gender in the American South through engagement with Billie Holiday's work.
